title: EU democratic deficit means unelected make policy

content.question: What is meant by the term “democratic deficit” in the European Union?

choices.label: Most new member states do not hold competitive elections.
Very few democratic parties (parties on the political left) are elected in European elections.
Turnout for domestic elections in all member states is decreasing.
Most decision making in the European Union is done by nonelected officials.
The European Union has a large deficit because of spending on agricultural subsidies.

content.answer: Most decision making in the European Union is done by nonelected officials.
